freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.font

Low level utilities for handling typographic related aspects of the xml tree.

Functions

get_lines_with_font(blk, font)

Return all the line with a certain font in a tree

get_lines_with_txt_font(blk, txt, font[, ...])

Get lines with a certain txt and font

is_present_txt_font(blk, txt, font)

Return if a certain pdf block with a specific text and font is present in the tree
freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.font.get_lines_with_font(blk: Element, font: str) → List[Element]

Return all the line with a certain font in a tree

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – tree from which extract lines

  • font (str) – font to extract

Returns:

list of relevant blocks

Return type:

List[etree.Element]

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.font.get_lines_with_txt_font(blk: Element, txt: str, font: str, all_elem: bool = False) → List[Element] | Element

Get lines with a certain txt and font

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – xml tree structure

  • txt (str) – text to search for

  • font (str) – font to search for

  • all_elem (bool, optional) – if True return a list with all matches, if False just the first as a scalar element

Returns:

matching lines

Return type:

List[etree.Element] | etree.Element

freeports_analysis.formats_utils.pdf_filter.xml.font.is_present_txt_font(blk: Element, txt: str, font: str) → bool

Return if a certain pdf block with a specific text and font is present in the tree

Parameters:

  • blk (etree.Element) – tree to search in

  • txt (str) – text to search

  • font (str) – font to search

Returns:

boolean describing if the block is present or not

Return type:

bool
